comment: Worst teacher ever. Kennesaw State University whoever is in charge of the hiring and firing process you need to fire him immediately. This guy doesnt belong in the teaching and learning process. Absolutely awful.

He is a good person, not a good teacher. He reads 50+ slides to the class in 30 minutes and then you have the rest of the time to do homework. He gets REALLY behind on grading and does "signal grading." He gives you a 1% and you have to meet with him, fix it and then resubmit. He gives 8-14 programs a week. If you know nothing about CS, don't take.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Assigns far to much work every week, lectures horrendously over 40+ slide powerpoints, and is usually over a month behind on grading.  Very least 8 programs a week.  Only teacher I've ever had that lectured an entire chapter immediately after a Test.  Tests are poorly made and bad representations of where your at, and how to measure your knowledge.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: His power points are informative but he requires a lot of work. Be prepared to write anywhere from 8 to 14 programs EVERY week. He does a lot of pop-quizzes and the grading on them can be harsh. If you are taking easier classes and okay with lots of work then he's fine, but if you're already going to be busy then look elsewhere.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES
Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Avoid. He claims that he grades based on proficiency and respects different coding styles, then will grade you based on how he likes your code. If anything you program fails one criteria, it gets a 0.

He is a horrible teacher. I have no previous knowledge with coding or java but he throws you into the programs and assignments with literally no introduction. If you take this class be prepared to teach yourself 95% of the material and the other 5% will be taught by your classmates.
Awful, awful teacher. He barely knew what was going on and how to set up the online grading and submitting for a HYBRID class. Avoid him like the plague, if he is even aloud to teach here again.

This is an awful professor and an awful teacher.  He is actively TRYING to give his students bad grades. He grades assignments based on a criteria which he doesnt tell you. If he doesn't like how you wrote your code (even if it works perfectly) he will take off from sections on the rubric you didn't even mess up. I have 10s for good assignments.

At the start of the semester, there was around 30 students. Now there's 8 students left in my section. Yes that many people dropped. The problem with this professor is that he will proactively try to find a way to deduct points from your programs and assignments. He doesn't teach, only shows us videos and expects we get it and doesn't sums it up.

This particular professor does not help you with your assignments. He would make up one rubric for you to submit the assignments and than create a brand new one and grade on the new rubric that you were not ready for. I will never take this teacher again in my life, because he is horrible at teaching and really weird in talking about code. Weirdo

This professor doesn't care about his students, he only cares about the money that the university is giving him. He will do the best he can to give you the lowest grade possible. You have a working program? Does it do what it's suppose to do without compile errors? All my programs are like this but he gives me just a 10% which is really unfair.

This professor really seems to try and be personable, and it is a shame then that he is just really unfair. He doesn't grade in a way that makes much sense and has an all or nothing approach. If you miss one thing or he does not like your program expect a 0 or 10%. He also seems to actively look to fail you specifically "could deduct points for."

He has no ability to communicate to students or understand their needs. He tends to retain a "politically correct" and stiffly formal tone and language when speaking to students in any context. He has extremely vague expectations and grades harshly for not meeting those vague expectations exactly. Don't expect much useful help from him.
